title: Evaluating Irrigation Infrastructure Development: An Inquiry-Based Learning Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental knowledge of water resource management and project evaluation concepts
context.additional_context: Learning evaluation methodologies for multinational irrigation projects, centered on the Telangana, India case study

learning_goals: They can comprehensively analyze the economic, technical, and environmental aspects of irrigation projects using the multi-criteria evaluation framework (INSPECT model) that considers diverse stakeholders.
They can design a process to solve real-world irrigation infrastructure development problems by applying Inquiry-Based Learning (IBL) methodologies.
They can prepare practical proposals for cultivable land assessment and irrigation planning optimization using GIS and data visualization tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
